0.user_question: Robert had 3 pounds of candy, Cindy had 5 pounds of candy, and Aaron had 4 pounds of candy after Halloween. If they decide to pool and share their candy equally with each other, how much candy would each of them have?

1.subquestion: Firstly calculate the total number of candies owned among all individuals.

subanswer.text: Total weight of candy combined equals 3 (Robert) + 5 (Cindy) + 4 (Aaron) = 12 pounds of candy.

2.subquestion: Next divide the shared candy evenly amongst themselves; what will be equal individual shares post division?

subanswer.text: Divide the total candy mass available by the count of people i.e., 12 lbs / 3 persons = 4 lbs per person. Each one gets an additional 4 lbs worth of candy from sharing pooled resources. Answer :|<endoftext|>

0.user_question: Robert had 3 pounds of candy, Cindy had 5 pounds of candy, and Aaron had 4 pounds of candy after Halloween. If they decide to pool and share their candy equally with each other, how much candy would each of them have?
